results.doc_title: NVE Product Roadmap Sharing - 2025/12/09 15:31 CET - Notes by Gemini
results.meeting_purpose: Review and align on 2026 product roadmap plans across various teams (TBT, Factor, Good Chop) to identify overlaps and opportunities to combine development and discovery efforts

decisions.what: TBT 2026 will operate in two streams: growth stream and retention stream with potentially separate backlogs
decisions.context: Organizational structure for 2026 strategy execution

decisions.what: Growth stream will follow a structure with main priority initiatives and quick wins
decisions.context: To maintain team motivation and pace while working on larger strategic projects

decisions.what: Prioritize pantry fresh product launch as strategic priority
decisions.context: Expanding product offering with fresh product that doesn't require refrigeration

decisions.what: Good Chop H1 priorities: OTP launch, price value experiment, and legacy code cleanup
decisions.context: Focus on conversion/retention improvement and technical debt reduction

action_items.task: Set up integration for Incom HelloFresh gift card partnership
action_items.timeline: Not specified - will keep team posted

action_items.task: Share roadmap with squad on Thursday and provide context on Shopify
Revamp signup page to remove add-on upsell messages
Expand SKU portfolio with new calorie options for very small and very big dogs

key_points: TBT 2026 strategy includes growth stream (SKU expansion, signup page revamp, pantry fresh product) and retention stream (digital feeding guides, dashboard improvements, cancellation deflection, plan recommendation engine)
Factor Q1 roadmap constrained by Shopify experiment outcome and new product development complexities
Factor focusing on OTP launch iterations, new product development (mealshake and creatine), and Factor app integration
Good Chop prioritizing OTP launch, price value experiment, and foundational funnel code cleanup
Discussion of third-party tool integrations: Beam (charity donations), Yachtpool (product ratings), Incom (HelloFresh gift card partnerships)
HelloFresh gift cards work as physical cards (similar to Xbox/Amazon cards) with cash credits redeemable on HelloFresh accounts
Heating was broken in main HelloFresh building in Berlin, causing team to meet in different building
blockers: Factor Q1 roadmap constrained by Shopify experiment outcome
SKU flexibility issues affecting new product development at Factor
Concern about how to frame Shopify changes to squad without causing alarm about web experience replacement
follow_ups: Monitor Shopify experiment outcome and its impact on roadmap
Coordinate on potential reuse of HelloFresh gift card system for other brands
Explore multi-brand gift card possibility
Frame Shopify discussion as rapid experimentation opportunity rather than replacement risk

entities.context: Team/product with 2026 strategy focused on growth and retention streams

entities.context: Product with Q1 roadmap including OTP launch and new product development

entities.context: Product with H1 roadmap focusing on OTP launch and price value experiments

entities.context: Platform being experimented with, outcome will constrain Factor roadmap

entities.context: Third-party tool for charity donations integration

entities.context: Partner for HelloFresh gift card partnerships in physical retail

entities.context: Parent brand with gift card system and Berlin headquarters

entities.context: New product type - fresh product not requiring refrigeration, strategic priority for TBT

entities.context: One-time purchase feature being launched by both Factor and Good Chop

results.doc_title: NVE Product Roadmap Sharing - 2025/12/09 15:31 CET - Notes by Gemini
results.meeting_purpose: Review and align on 2026 product roadmap plans across various teams (TBT, Factor, Good Chop) to identify overlaps and opportunities to combine development and discovery efforts

decisions.what: TBT 2026 will operate in two streams: growth stream and retention stream with potentially separate backlogs
decisions.context: Organizational structure for 2026 strategy execution

decisions.what: Growth stream will follow a structure with main priority initiatives and quick wins
decisions.context: To maintain team motivation and pace while working on larger strategic projects

decisions.what: Prioritize pantry fresh product launch as strategic priority
decisions.context: Expanding product offering with fresh product that doesn't require refrigeration

decisions.what: Good Chop H1 roadmap prioritizes OTP launch, price value experiment, and legacy code cleanup
decisions.context: Focus on conversion/retention improvement and technical debt reduction

action_items.task: Keep team posted on integration setup for HelloFresh gift card partnership
Share roadmap with squad on Thursday and provide context on Shopify
Frame Shopify experiment to team without causing concern

key_points: TBT 2026 Growth Stream: Expanding SKU portfolio with new calorie options for very small and very big dogs
TBT Quick Win: Signup page revamp to improve intent to proceed by removing confusing add-on messages
TBT Strategic Priority: Pantry fresh product launch (fresh product without refrigeration requirement)
TBT Retention Stream: Fully digital feeding guides, dashboard improvements, tailored cancellation deflection, plan recommendation engine
Factor Q1 roadmap constrained by Shopify experiment outcome and new product development complexities
Factor initiatives: OTP launch iterations, new product development (mealshake and creatine), Factor app integration
Factor facing SKU flexibility issues
Good Chop H1: OTP launch, price value experiment for conversion/retention, foundational work to clean up legacy code in funnel
Third-party tool integrations discussed: Beam (charity donations), Yachtpool (product ratings), Incom (HelloFresh gift card partnerships)
HelloFresh gift cards work with cash credits system that drop onto accounts for redemption in next box
Physical gift cards similar to Xbox/Amazon cards available in stores
Shopify experiment positioned as way to rapidly experiment with offers for various customers
blockers: Heating broken in main HelloFresh building in Berlin (long-term issue)
Factor Q1 roadmap constrained by Shopify experiment outcome
Factor facing SKU flexibility issues with new product development
follow_ups: Monitor Q1 progress as it's closer to concrete while rest of year likely to change
Coordinate on potential reuse of HelloFresh gift card system for other brands
Explore possibility of multi-brand gift card that could benefit multiple products
Thursday squad presentation on roadmap and Shopify context

results.doc_title: Nikita / Beatrice - 2025/12/08 17:31 CET - Notes by Gemini
results.meeting_purpose: Discuss technical implementation and strategy for one-time purchase (OTP) functionality across different customer segments, particularly for active customers

decisions.what: Use redirect to Shopify for OTP implementation if it's faster/cheaper than building a proper endpoint
decisions.context: Weighing technical implementation options for one-time purchases, considering that redirect would be significantly cheaper (20% of cost) and faster

decisions.what: Enable OTP for active customers as a Q1 deliverable
decisions.context: Despite lower confidence in impact compared to former customers, the capability is cheap to deliver and can generate revenue without additional spending

decisions.what: First iteration will use minimal UI work with redirect to plans page with OTP option
decisions.context: Simplest implementation approach, avoiding more complex features like occasion boxes or preset boxes initially

action_items.task: Implement marketplace banner in next dashboard delivery suggesting users try marketplace beta for meat with one-off box option
Confirm OTP implementation approach (minimal UI + redirect to plans page) with Alex
Determine placement for active customer OTP feature in roadmap

key_points: Dashboard delivery will include banner promoting marketplace beta for meat with one-off box delivery in two days
Customer address details should ideally transfer at checkout, potentially using Shop Pay for express checkout
Prospect experience already has component that redirects OTP users back to plans page
OTP capability already exists for prospects and ex-customers, making it logical to extend to active customers
Even small adoption (2 customers) could generate ~$700 in revenue without additional spending
More complex features like occasion boxes or preset boxes would require additional work

blockers.issue: Order management concerns when using Shopify redirect
blockers.context: Need to maintain entry point to direct customers back from Shopify

blockers.issue: No current support for discounts for active customers
blockers.context: Mentioned as limitation in current system

follow_ups: Confirmation needed with Alex on implementation approach
Assess whether to include occasion boxes or preset boxes in future iterations
Monitor customer feedback after OTP is enabled for active customers

entities.context: Core feature being discussed for implementation across customer segments (prospects, ex-customers, active customers)

results.doc_title: Nikita / Prateek (Deep Dive) - 2025/12/05 13:04 CET - Notes by Gemini
results.meeting_purpose: Deep dive discussion on pet health app development strategy, content approach, and customer engagement to improve retention and social proof

decisions.what: Develop a pet health app that measures and communicates pet health improvements to users
decisions.context: Company has weak history in content strategy and daily active users, but recognizes potential of app to provide social proof and improve retention

decisions.what: Define smallest possible product and test ideas before committing significant resources
decisions.context: Need to build confidence through testing before heavy investment

decisions.what: Add survey questions to existing commercial team surveys to understand pet owner concerns
decisions.context: Commercial team runs surveys every 2 weeks to monthly with good response rates; Lindsay from TPT team manages in-depth surveys

decisions.what: Provide basic tracking capabilities to all pet owners who download app, not just active customers
decisions.context: Broader accessibility to drive engagement and usage

action_items.task: Start work on login page and write one-pager for stage one and stage two plans
Send contact for Lindsay and add Prateek to TPT team for survey visibility
Work with designer Katrina to ensure right survey questions are asked
Ensure Katrina has bandwidth for design work and push back on distractions from senior director
Connect with Yara (dog owner of Boba) to understand target audience perspective

key_points: Power user demographics identified as 'dinks' (Dual Income, No Kids) in metro areas who pamper pets with fresh frozen food
Average US spend per dog is $1.6k per year - highest globally
Pet owners have emotional attachment and notice health improvements, but company should help measure and communicate these improvements
App concept connected to solving retention problem, similar to high utility of Amazon Prime
Need to understand top 5 worries/thoughts pet owners have to drive daily usage and engagement
Latest available survey data was from August 2025

blockers.context: Distractions from senior director affecting capacity for this project

blockers.issue: Company's weak history in content strategies and daily active user increases
blockers.context: Creates caution about investing heavily in content despite recognizing interest

follow_ups: Review one-pager for stage planning
Access and review survey results (latest from August)
Determine specific survey questions to add to commercial team surveys
Define metrics for measuring pet health improvements
Establish how health improvements will be communicated to users for social proof

results.doc_title: Notes - Shopping & NV Team Leads Weekly
results.meeting_purpose: Weekly sync between Shopping & New Ventures Team Leads to discuss Q1 planning, project status, blockers, and coordination

decisions.what: Undercommit and deliver approach for Q1 planning
decisions.context: To avoid overcommitting and under-delivering, teams should focus on top 3 items per team and be dogmatic about priorities

decisions.what: Sprint review and tribe demos to start January 5th
decisions.context: Reporting on weeks 2, 4, 6, etc. with Nikita investigating automation

decisions.what: Autonomous calibration for TPT conversion/retention split
decisions.context: 1:1:1 split can't always apply as these are business units, not just squads. Teams should calibrate based on top priorities

decisions.what: Q1 planning to be completed by November 27th
decisions.context: Q1 plans to include December for new teams

Investigate automation for sprint reporting
